subject: College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Washington State quarterback Gary Rogers was able to walk out of a hospital the day after breaking a bone in his spine. Rogers, a fifth-year senior, was hurt on a late hit Saturday in the Cougars’ 48-9 victory over Portland State. The fractured vertebra did not require surgery. The team said his expected recovery time was three to four months.
